Reviews.Title: Not Great, but OK
Reviews.Author: Finster
Reviews.Content: I do have to say that this phone serves it's purpose.  I bought it because I wanted a smart phone, but I did not want to pay AT&T; for a Data plan I did not need.  I also did not want to spend a lot of money, only to find out the AT&T; will find out I have a smart phone and automattically add a data plan.  I have had it for a few months now and have only seen one $2 charge for some data.  Not sure where that came from since I thought that the data settings had all been disabled on the phone, but so far that is all I have seen.  No other data charges yet.  As for the functionality of the phone, sometimes the screen seems a little slow to refresh, possibly due to the slow 600MHz processor.  Also the camera does not autofocus which can make it difficult to scan bar codes if they are too small.  Memory space is limited, so if you like to play with apps, you will need to move them to the SD card (2GB was included).  Voice quality is fine and battery life seems good.  I leave Wifi, Bluetooth and GPS enabled all the time, but I don't talk alot on it and I have to charge it about every 3 days.  Seems to be a decent starter phone for the money.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad at All...
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Received phone unlocked as purchased.  Plugged in a pay as you go SIM card from Cyprus (the island) and it worked just fine.  GPS, Wi-Fi, etc all worked fine with no issues.  Yes, as some have pointed out when messaging if you have big fingers it can be an issue.  I just found a way to touch the keys so that I wasn't making mis-types.  I guess if there was any issue I have with the phone it would be with the LG app advisor as it doesn't work but really I don't need it or miss it.  Nice phone, not too big and very capable.  I am very satisfied with the phone and all it has to offer.

Reviews.Title: LG P350 Unlocked Phone
Reviews.Author: Hyacinth
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my cousin who lives in Jamaica. He likes it and it works for him.I really don't know too much about it's function.

Reviews.Title: love the phone
Reviews.Author: I_HATE_THIS "Like what I said before"
Reviews.Content: I replaced my Nexus One with this little phone.  At first, I wanted a iPhone, but decided against if because of the price.I am very skeptical about getting another Android phone.  My experience with my Nexus One is horrible.  The touch screen constantly register the wrong signal or wouldn't response unless I power it on/off.  But I don't want to spend too much on an smart phone, so, I decided to go for a least expensive Android phone.The phone has two cons, for me, it is 2.2.2, some of my app need later version Android.  Another complaint is slow CPU, the menu would froze for a few second from time to time.  But no reset require, just the CPU is catching up.For the many pros.  It is small, yes 3.5 inch screen, but I only use it for tethering with T-Mobile $2/day prepaid.  So, you won't get any complaint from me about its screen.  Its touch screen is very accurate, and compare from Nexus One, it is like day and night.  I haven't try to stress test the battery, but it seems to last 6-7 hrs on WiFi mode alone.  The multi-touch is a bit slow, but it could be the CPU slow.

Reviews.Title: Screen is small not enough to type the characters or words properly.
Reviews.Author: Swamy
Reviews.Content: Not the latest Android version available hence all the latest features are not available.3G phone. Hence wherever there is 4G network, couldn't able to use the same and its uses 2G which reduces the speed.If we spend little bit more we can get good phone with Latest features from LG itself (already using the 2 phones in the family)GPS has no issue however since the screen not enough to look and use the GPS while driving.Screen is small not enough to type the characters or words properly

Reviews.Title: Easy phone to use.
Reviews.Author: Joanna P.
Reviews.Content: Good phone for someone who wants to start off with a touch screen, but doesn't know too much about technology (a phone I got for my mother). When I first got the product it started off in Spanish, but it easy to change when starting up the phone since it gives that option for the language. Only thing is that the phone is quite small, because of that it is hard for mother to see the letters sometimes. However, she loves that it is tiny because it is very light and doesn't take up space, plus has all the basic apps she needs. Such as alarm, calendar, 3.5mm jack, accepts mini SD to store all her music, pictures and apps, and is the same size charger as her kindle (which makes it a lot easier for her).

Reviews.Title: lg p350 phone
Reviews.Author: shirley
Reviews.Content: well, i really like the description of the item...i thought the only thing that was missing was the information about the 3G internet. The item was delivered on time and it was exactly what i was expecting!

Reviews.Title: I like it so far
Reviews.Author: Gawain "Bacon & Butter"
Reviews.Content: Received this phone quickly for standard free shipping, My first smartest phone. Bought to replace a dying AT&T; GO phone I just popped in the sim chip after charging and it works. I turned off the data option in phone and use the wifi only. With my Go Phone  account I add money when needed and can buy data or texting on month to month basis. I have never purchased either data or text with my old phone. The LG p350 has a quick enough interface for me. It came with a 2gb micro card but I am replacing that with 8gb. The manual came in German and I downloaded an english pdf version with a Google search. Really have not used it much yet since only owned for three days. Will add to review after more experience with it, but so far delighted with purchase.Can't really speak of battery charge, I have been playing around too much to determine battery usage. Phone comes with a LG sync program to load on a pc, its on the LG sim chip. After loading it the sync process became available but It would not sync contacts or messages with my Thunderbird email client, seems to want Outlook. This is not a deal breaker for me as long as I can back up the contacts on my pc.Upon first turn up I did do a software upgrade on my wifi, this can also be done with LG pc interface program. I did take a photo and is better than my precious phone but not near pocket camera quality.

Reviews.Title: LG Unlocked at Amazon
Reviews.Author: Blanca Aviles
Reviews.Content: Great phone and excellent customer service.  Highly recommend the LG P350 Unlocked Phone.  Of course the price is great and affordable.

Reviews.Title: German manual
Reviews.Author: Tiger Monitor
Reviews.Content: there are no other instructions inside the box, not even a printout in English, just an email address from which to request the English manual.But, nobody answered.So, the phone is going back, and the seller is rated one - because there is no 0 - for wasting my time.

Reviews.Title: slowest phone I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Edward Auger
Reviews.Content: This phone takes up to a minute to even get to the phone menu and then it freezes up not allowing me to unlock it this phone reminds me of windows ME I would not recommend this phone to anyone I am sending it back

Reviews.Title: Next To Zero Instructions
Reviews.Author: Johnny  Justice
Reviews.Content: Phone came with next to zero instructions. I bought a sim card and used it one time to make a call to USA. I tried to locate data network in settings to cut data downloads off with no success.  I also had some of my fellow travelers try and  locate data networks setting to disable, and they had no success either. My one 2 minute call costed me $25. When I tried to place another call all my minutes had been consumed by data downloads.The phone may be a wonderful phone, but lack of instructions never gave me the opportunity to see if it was.

Reviews.Title: Not Compatible with T-Mobile
Reviews.Author: cinde kester
Reviews.Content: Does not work with T-MOBILE service plan. Unable to download apps. This makes the phone not compatible for my son.

Reviews.Title: Great phone does what it say.
Reviews.Author: Maurice Huggins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my wife and it works well for a small phone. my wife love it. It has lots of apps for a little phone, it down load stuff very easy. So I will recommend this phone for any one who want a good phone for a cheap price.

Reviews.Title: Smartphone
Reviews.Author: Alba
Reviews.Content: It is a lower end smartphone. If you can afford a better one, go with that. This does do well though it has it's shortcomings. It slows down or freezes after a while. It has a small screen. It's battery can last (or at least lasted for me) up to 1 and a half days. You can add more memory to it though. It is touchscreen. It's unlocked to you can use any service provider you decide to go with and you can use it internationally (depending on your service provider of course). Low quality pictures and recording. Untrustworthy GPS. I would recommend getting another phone if possible.

Reviews.Title: Good Battery Life Phone
Reviews.Author: Kathy Johnston
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my husband.  He claims it does not notify him of a text message, voice mail or a missed call.  I've yet to see what's what but will check it out.  The size and battery life are very good.

Reviews.Title: A great phone but do your homework
Reviews.Author: Erich Trapp
Reviews.Content: This really is a great unlocked phone. But I eventually wanted to switch its use from AT&T; to Verizon. Oops. If I'd done my homework better, I'd have known Verizon doesn't currently use a removable sim card. (They said that's on the horizon.) But the quality of the LG phone is excellent and comes with a nice little package of pre-installed apps. If you'r over 40 you might want to find a 14 year old to help you program it. I had to download the directions for use (thicker than the phone). Remember, a smart phone is only as smart as the user. Only complaint is that the battery runs down pretty fast as apps eat up energy. LG products have always been reliable for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone
Reviews.Author: Sandy in Texas
Reviews.Content: Very nice Android phone. It works perfectly with my SIM card and my "Square". I have a windows smartphone that I carry all the time and use this one for when the Square is going to used. I was very happy it worked as I expected. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Fine with me
Reviews.Author: tellc
Reviews.Content: It could but faster but for the price I have on problem with it. I use the speaker phone alot and it's really clear. No problems keeping up with my facebook or email. I would recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: BUEN PRODUCTO!
Reviews.Author: anali
Reviews.Content: ESTE CELULAR ES MUY BUENO, ES MI SEGUNDA COMPRA DE ESTE CELULAR... PORQUE EL PRIMERO TIENE MI HIJO MAYOR, Y ESTE TIENE MI HIJO MENOR... ME GUSTA MUCHO... POR MENOS PARA QUE COMIENCEN CON CELULARES INTELIGENTES, ESTE ES EXCELENTE!!!

Reviews.Title: terrible......
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: The phone instructions, apps etc,etc... we're all in gibberish even after you chose English option.Could not access internet or playstore. Worst phone ever.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Heeren
Reviews.Content: O ítem é excelente, muito útil, prático e um designe avançado... Muito boa compra... Gostei muito... Compraria novamente se necessário...

Reviews.Title: light and useful
Reviews.Author: Ajith
Reviews.Content: Excellent phone for the price. Has all required utilities needed and it is light weight. probably couple more features like radio would be nice

Reviews.Title: Excellence
Reviews.Author: Chapulina
Reviews.Content: The best cellphone I've ever had!!!!Just like new, Android rocks, I'm so happy. Very easy to use, with all the accesories.

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone will work on GSM carries like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported.
Unlocked Quad-Band cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 GSM and 3G HSDPA 900/2100 Mhz frequencies plus GPRS/Edge data capabilities.
3.15 MP Camera with 2048x1536 pixels, autofocus, Geo-tagging and Video Recorder; Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g, Wi-Fi hotspot; Bluetooth v2.1 with A2DP, EDR; microSD, up to 32GB; Stereo FM radio with RDS and GPS Navigator with A-GPS support.
Android OS, v2.2 (Froyo); Social networking integration; Google Search, Maps, Gmail; Digital compass; YouTube, Google Talk; Document viewer; Organizer; Voice memo; Predictive text inputa and MP4/H.264/H.263/WMV - MP3/WAV/WMA/eAAC+ player.
Talk time up to 7 hours - Standby up to 510 hours.
ProductInfo.Name: LG P350 Unlocked Phone with Android OS, Video Recorder, GPS Navigation, Stereo Bluetooth, 3 MP Camera and Wi-Fi (LG OPTIMUS ME BLK)
